titleStmt.title: Wallace Davis to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1180

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Headquarters Casey's Division,
Department of Washington,
Washington, Oct 21.st, 18634.
Governor,

Will you do me the honor to enclose me the great seal of the state of "Kentucky" to place among a collection of seals of the states & chief cities now in course of compilation for historical purposes. Please also enclose the arms of the state. I have the seal & arms of every state except "Kentucky" & I earnestly desire that to complete the record.

I am Governor, Your humble svt.
Wallace Davis
Chief Clerk,
Hd Qrs Maj Gen Casey
Washington, D.C.

To Hon Thos E Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky
